titleStmt.title: J. T. Caldwell et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8677

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: The undersigned respectfully represent to his Excellency J. F. Robinson Governor of the State of Kentucky -- That W. D. Sanders -- a young man of this county forfeited his recognizance on a charge of forgery at the Sept Term 1861 of the Shelby Circuit ^Court^. The forgery was for a trivial amount & the young man's uncle -- J J Sanders was his surety -- he is a poor and honest man and is laboring hard to support his sister & brother's children -- a large family -- He has paid thirty three per cent of the forefeiture & costs -- & the thing is very oppressive on him -- The bond was one hundred dollars -- We therefore petition your Excellency to remit the residue of the fine -- --

J. T Caldwell Judge Shelby C. C.
C M Harwood Co Atty
John Robinson Clk Circt Ct
J T
J. M. & W. C. Bullock
John T Ballard Clk Cty. Ct.
T. B & J. B. Cochran
J. G. Hansbrough S, S, C

From Shelby Cir. Ct
W. D. Sanders Pettn to remit fine
$100 } Recog
One half forfeiture is remitted
J F Robinson
J. J. Sanders
Issd Mar 7. 1863
